name: Alpha Strike Build? Ideas for Max Damage First Round Unarmed Build
author: CZero

posts.author: CZero
posts.content:
So, like the title says, I'll be editing this as I journey on my quest for squeezing out every last bit of damage on that first round with my bare fists!

Welcome to ideas and if there's already a guide, I'll search and find them and post them in here as well.
This is my first post, but I plan to make it into a full build once I've tweaked it to my liking.

Only real guidelines are that it'll be unarmed only, and I'm not looking for DPS, just straight out damage on the first hit or flurry of hits.

Divine Might + Smite + Sneak?

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Well, DA on the first hit with the highest DC possible on an opponent that can be paralysed by it is probably one of the highest potentials, I think.

Though certainly a Smiter with all the bells doing a first attack will probably be able to post the most damage (especially if it crits! O_o)

What about with Improved PA active?  And a Cleric/Monk with DP, perhaps? 

Let me see - at the most, 5 attacks in one flurry.  For that, we would need 13 attacks in one round.  Thinking about how to obtain that with Unarmed Attacks, because two-weapon is out.

We would need Haste, of course.  FoBs I think is a no brainer here.  Throw in perhaps Circle Kick for an extra attack.  I think DP is going to be necessary here, to get more attacks...iirc.

Not sure if we can get 13 attacks with Unarmed.  Might have to settle for 10, which would mean at most 4 attacks in the first flurry.

After we figure out how many attacks we can do in the first flurry, then it is a matter of comparing bonuses and what is possible with them.

Divine Might + Smite is going to mean some Cha, which would take away from Str here - so there is that.  Are we also comparing hit chances, or just the result if everything hits?

If the latter, then we want Improved Power Attack on, right?  And level 20 Monk for that d20 damage.  Are we going max damage on the hit(s) as well?

Are we going from a nekkid build, or can we add in all the bells and whistles (like extra attacks)?  Just wondering what the parameters are here.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Can those fists cast spells? If so, that opens up for some really heavy area of attack spells.
The vanilla version of Harm can do some serious damage to high HP bosses. It is a spell, OK, but you have to land a melee touch attack for it to work.

Web pointed at smiters and a sneak (death-) attackers. They can dish out some heavy punches. However, smiters work better with weapons, because you can keen them and also use the Weapon master class for more impressive crits. Weapon master also let you max damage with their ki attack.

Another damage dealer is Ranger-heavy Ranger/Fighter, with Bane weapon and EWS.

You may also want to look at the Paladin/RDD combination (with Sorcerer of Bard to qualify for RDD). It can go heavy on both strength and charisma and has spells that improve both AB and damage.

Builds with HIPS will in many situations let you repeat the alpha strike.

posts.author: Ten Pura
posts.content:
Just running some rough, theoretical numbers, a dedicated smiter puts out the most damage in the first hit.

A dedicated sneaker should come close on average damage, but unless the sneaker has some impossibly good rolls, is unlikely to break 500 in the first flurry, while the smiter should hit around 800 on a crit.

This all assumes both characters are naked, only buffed with Bull's Strength and self-buffs, all hits in the first flurry connect, that the target is evil (smiteable), and probably a bunch of other stuff I've forgotten to mention.

So if you don't mind only being able to do crazy damage against evil things (and really underwhelming against others), go dedicated smiter. Otherwise, a Rogue 37/Monk 1/Assassin 1 (I know it's only 39 levels, but the last one doesn't matter) with all the sneak attack you can put in it is the best unarmed, first flurry damage.

Again, all this goes out the window when you involve weapons.

I don't have my desktop with me to generate a full build right now, sorry.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Are you maximising damage for a particular opponent or are you just aiming for a theoretical maximum? Maximising damage is a lot harder than maximising AB or AC due to how many variables are involved and how many potential damage sources there are.
What's your opponents AC? Are they immune to Sneak Attack or critical hits? Do they have any DI/DR? Do they have concealment or Epic Dodge? Can you KD them to generate more Sneak Attacks? Can you smite them? Will you be using enchanted gear/gloves or be completely naked?

There's no point aiming for Monk16 when you get the unarmed APR increase with Monk1. It's very unlikely that those 15 levels are worth using to increase your base damage from 1d6 to 1d20.

I'll focus on 3 minmaxed builds for 3 categories: Pal29/CoT10/Monk1, Monk4/Figh8/BG28, and Rog33/Figh6/Monk1. Note that it's probably possible to improve upon all 3 builds in their respective categories, but I don't think it's worth doing if this is just theory-building.

If your opponent is evil then a smiter has the best damage. A minmaxed Pal29/CoT10/Monk1 is one of the highest damage dealers with a +429 damage Smite Evil, although it's possible to improve upon this (eg Pal19/CoT20/Monk1).
I'll assume it has +12 STR, +12 CHA, and Haste.
Self-buffed AB for the first round with Flurry Of Blows (split into flurries) is +56/+53/+50 / +47/+44/+41 / +56/+51 (+14 Smite Evil).
Self-buffed AB for the first flurry with IPA is +48/+45/+42 (+14 Smite Evil).
Self-buffed damage is 1d6 + 12 (+429 Smite Evil) Physical + 19 Divine + 5 Magical (19-20/x2).
The Divine and Magical damage both ignore DI/DR, so even monsters with 100% DI to all damage types will take 24 damage per hit.
Minimum non-Smite damage is 37, minimum non-Smite damage is 74.
Minimum Smite Evil damage is 466, minimum Smite Evil critical is 932, add 10/20 when using IPA (476/952).
Assuming that all attacks hit and don't crit (which is a bad assumption), and that all three Smites are used with FoB, that is a minimum of 1583 damage in one round.
Assuming that all attacks hit and don't crit (bad assumption), and that all three Smites are used in your opening flurry with IPA, that is a minimum of 1428 damage in your opening flurry.

If your opponent is good then a smiter has the best damage. A minmaxed Monk4/Figh8/BG28 has a +308 damage Smite Good and a +9d6 Sneak Attack (average of 31.5 damage per Sneak Attack).
I'll assume it has +12 STR, +12 CHA, and Haste.
Self-buffed AB for the first round with Flurry Of Blows (split into flurries) is +42/+39/+36 / +33/+30/+27 / +42/+37 (+14 Smite Good)
Self-buffed AB for the first flurry with IPA is +34/+31/+28 (+14 Smite Good).
Self-buffed damage is 1d8 + 17 (+308 Smite Good) (+9d6 Sneak Attack) Physical + 14 Divine (19-20/x2).
The Divine damage ignores DI/DR, so that's a minimum of 14 damage per hit regardless of how tough the opponent is.
Average non-Smite Sneak Attack damage is 67, average non-Smite Sneak Attack critical is 102.5.
Average Sneak Attack Smite Good damage is 375, average Sneak Attack Smite Good critical is 718.5, add 10/20 when using IPA (385/738.5)
Assuming that all attacks hit and don't crit (bad assumption), that all three Smites are used with FoB, that you generate Sneak Attacks on your first flurry, and that you KD on the first flurry to get all 8 Sneak Attacks, that is an average of 1460 damage in one round.
Assuming that all attacks hit and don't crit (bad assumption), that all three Smites are used in your opening flurry with IPA, and that you generate Sneak Attacks on your first flurry, that is an average of 1155 damage in your opening flurry.

If your opponent is neutral but is vulnerable to sneak attacks then a sneaker is best. A minmaxed Rog33/Figh6/Monk1 has a +27d6 Sneak Attack, which gives an average of 94.5 damage per Sneak Attack.
I'll assume it has +12 STR and Haste.
Self-buffed AB for the first round with Flurry Of Blows (split into flurries) is +44/+41/+38 / +35/+32/+29 / +44/+39.
Self-buffed AB for the first flurry with IPA is +36/+33/+30.
Self-buffed damage is 1d6 + 22 (+27d6 Sneak Attack) Physical (19-20/x2).
Average Sneak Attack damage is 120, average Sneak Attack critical is 145.5, add 10/20 when using IPA (130/165.5)
Assuming that all attacks hit and don't crit (bad assumption), that you generate Sneak Attacks on your first flurry, and that you KD on the first flurry to get all 8 Sneak Attacks, that is an average of 960 damage in one round with FoB.
Assuming that all attacks hit and don't crit (bad assumption), and that you generate Sneak Attacks on your first flurry, that is an average of 390 damage in your opening flurry with IPA.
Even if we assume that you do maximum damage on every hit (190/200 with IPA) those numbers become 1520 in one round or 600 in your opening flurry, which are both lower than the corresponding minimum damage a Pal29/CoT10/Monk1 does.

If your opponent is both neutral and has Sneak Attack immunity then things become more interesting, but at that point the best build depends on your opponent. The classes to focus on are Monk (obviously), Cleric, Fighter, Paladin, Ranger, Blackguard, and CoT.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Even if you narrow it down to a smiter, if you want the highest damage possible I'd need to know more about the environment you play in and your potential opponents. Bear in mind that Divine Wrath is a once per day feat and Smite Evil has three uses per day, after those feats are used up the build won't be anything special.

What magic level is available? +5EB /+5AC? You've said that +12 STR/CHA is available, will you be able to get +12 DEX/CON/WIS or Haste as well?
What sort of opponents will you be facing? Low AC or High AC? Will Bludgeoning DI/DR be a problem? Is critical hit immunity common? Is dispel an issue for low level buffs?
You said you only care about the first hit at level 40, so I'm assuming that playability or survivability aren't things you care about? You also want to focus on burst damage over consistent damage? Do you want the best damage for the first round or for the first flurry?

Pal29/CoT10/Monk1 is my default smiter, modifying it to fight unarmed is very easy. If you want to play a balanced build that can also do a lot of damage I'd recommend a balanced Pal29/CoT10/Monk1. If you want to minmax purely for damage then other Pal/CoT or Pal/CoT/Monk builds will be better, although how much better depends on both the opponent and available equipment. It's effectively a choice between better Paladin buffs and a better Divine Wrath, there is no singular best unarmed smiter.

Also, on this PW the following changes affect this build I think, but won't affect the first flurry, of course:

  • Divine Shield: duration increased to x1.5 charisma modifier rounds.
  • Divine Wrath: daily uses increased to 3. Duration increased to turns instead of rounds (PURE modifier, bonus from different sources are not considered).

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
This is a rough build guide for a fully minmaxed Pal29/CoT10/Monk1. Other fully minmaxed Pal/CoT/Monk builds, such as Pal19/CoT20/Monk1 or Pal24/CoT15/Monk1, are built in practically the same way. It can self-buff to +13 AB, so you will reach the AB cap if the available gloves are +7 AB or above.

If I'm understanding the changes correctly, Divine Might lasts for 21 rounds and Divine Wrath has 3 uses per day and a duration of 8 turns (instead of 14 turns). This is a nice improvement to the build and means it will still be useful even after smiting. With the increased duration it's tempting to get Divine Shield too, but this would require lowering your offence slightly.

The build is designed to be played as a normal sword and board Paladin up to level 32, when it finally gains access to Monk unarmed APR. If you want to play unarmed from level 1 then the feats will need to be rearranged. You can move the Monk level anywhere from level 21 to 40, it's even possible to move it to pre-epic levels but that wouldn't result in a fully minmaxed build.

The levels and feats can be rearranged depending on what you prioritise, but you can't make many changes to the feat selection if you want a fully minmaxed build. I chose to focus in scimitars for the increased crit range, but any simple or martial melee weapon will work. Even without IC: Scimitar the threat range is larger than your unarmed threat range, and with a keened scimitar there is a significant difference. Knockdown can be swapped for Divine Shield or IPA but personally I'd recommend sticking with KD. You can drop two ability feats and end with 18 STR in order to gain two epic feats, but this won't give you a fully minmaxed build. For example, this would let you pick up Divine Shield and ESF: Discipline.

If you want more skills (such as Spot or Taunt) you will need to make a more balanced build.

Since it's just a rough build I didn't bother with a full skill progression.
